rules.natural: Under the condition that the participant oversleeps, if the participant is late to the conference, then the participant misses the keynote.
If the participant checks the schedule, then the participant sees a conflict.
Provided that the participant sees a conflict, the participant reviews the policy.
Whenever the participant contacts the organizer, if it is not the case that having a ticket for the event implies presenting technology, then the participant does not get a refund for the ticket.
If the participant reviews the policy, then the participant contacts the organizer.
Under the condition that the participant has programming skill, if the participant does not present technology, then the participant attends the workshop.
Provided that the participant has design skill, if the participant does not present technology, then the participant attends the workshop.
The participant practices coding or the participant practices prototyping.
Whenever the participant practices prototyping, the participant has design skill.
If the participant studies algorithms, then if the participant practices coding, the participant has programming skill.
The participant studies algorithms or the participant studies interfaces.
Under the condition that the participant studies interfaces, if the participant practices coding, then the participant has programming skill.
Provided that the participant is distracted, the participant is late to the conference.
Whenever it is not the case that having a ticket for the event implies presenting technology, the participant gets a refund for the ticket.
Under the condition that it is not the case that the participant drinks alcohol or presents technology, the participant is distracted.

facts.natural: The participant has a ticket for the event.
It is not the case that the participant attends the workshop.
The participant does not miss the keynote.
The participant does not drink alcohol.

(A11 → A10).natural: If the participant is late to the conference, then the participant misses the keynote.

(A12 → (A11 → A10)).natural: Under the condition that the participant oversleeps, if the participant is late to the conference, then the participant misses the keynote.

(A13 → G).natural: Provided that the participant has a ticket for the event, the participant presents technology.

(A15 → (¬(A13 → G) → ¬A14)).natural: Whenever the participant checks the schedule, if it is not the case that having a ticket for the event implies presenting technology, then the participant does not get a refund for the ticket.

(A15 → A16).natural: If the participant checks the schedule, then the participant sees a conflict.

(A16 → (¬(A13 → G) → ¬A14)).natural: Under the condition that the participant sees a conflict, if it is not the case that having a ticket for the event implies presenting technology, then the participant does not get a refund for the ticket.

(A16 → A17).natural: If the participant sees a conflict, then the participant contacts the organizer.

(A16 → A18).natural: Provided that the participant sees a conflict, the participant reviews the policy.

(A17 → (¬(A13 → G) → ¬A14)).natural: Whenever the participant contacts the organizer, if it is not the case that having a ticket for the event implies presenting technology, then the participant does not get a refund for the ticket.

(A18 → A17).natural: If the participant reviews the policy, then the participant contacts the organizer.

(A2 → (¬G → A1)).natural: Under the condition that the participant has programming skill, if the participant does not present technology, then the participant attends the workshop.

(A2 ∨ A3).natural: The participant has programming skill or the participant has design skill.

(A3 → (¬G → A1)).natural: Provided that the participant has design skill, if the participant does not present technology, then the participant attends the workshop.

(A4 → A2).natural: If the participant practices coding, then the participant has programming skill.

(A4 ∨ A5).natural: The participant practices coding or the participant practices prototyping.

(A5 → A3).natural: Whenever the participant practices prototyping, the participant has design skill.

(A6 → (A4 → A2)).natural: If the participant studies algorithms, then if the participant practices coding, the participant has programming skill.

(A6 ∨ A7).natural: The participant studies algorithms or the participant studies interfaces.

(A7 → (A4 → A2)).natural: Under the condition that the participant studies interfaces, if the participant practices coding, then the participant has programming skill.

(A8 ∨ G).natural: The participant drinks alcohol or the participant presents technology.

(A9 → A10).natural: If the participant is distracted, then the participant misses the keynote.

(A9 → A11).natural: Provided that the participant is distracted, the participant is late to the conference.

(¬(A13 → G) → A14).natural: Whenever it is not the case that having a ticket for the event implies presenting technology, the participant gets a refund for the ticket.

(¬(A13 → G) → ¬A14).natural: If it is not the case that having a ticket for the event implies presenting technology, then the participant does not get a refund for the ticket.

(¬(A8 ∨ G) → A9).natural: Under the condition that it is not the case that the participant drinks alcohol or presents technology, the participant is distracted.

(¬G → A1).natural: If the participant does not present technology, then the participant attends the workshop.

A13.natural: The participant has a ticket for the event.

¬A1.natural: It is not the case that the participant attends the workshop.

¬A10.natural: The participant does not miss the keynote.

¬A8.natural: The participant does not drink alcohol.

¬A9.natural: It is not the case that the participant is distracted.
